definitions.definition: To give in or be swayed ; to become less hard, harsh , or cruel ; to show clemency .
examples: He had planned to ground his son for a month, but relented and decided to give him a stern lecture instead.
We waited for the storm to relent before we ventured outside.
He will not relent in his effort to reclaim his victory.

definitions.definition: To lessen , make less severe or intense.
To become less rigid or hard ; to soften ; to yield , for example by dissolving or melting

main_definition: ( intransitive ) To give in or be swayed ; to become less hard, harsh , or cruel ; to show clemency .
secondary_definitions: ( obsolete , transitive ) To lessen , make less severe or intense.
( dated , intransitive , of substance ) To become less rigid or hard ; to soften ; to yield , for example by dissolving or melting
